definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand

sentences.english: He was a man of much worldly wisdom, and in some ways resembled Voltaire.
sentences.chinese: 他精于人情世故，在某些方面酷似伏尔泰。

sentences.english: No one doubts that the Chevalier and Voltaire met and conversed.
sentences.chinese: 骑士先生和伏尔泰曾经会面和交谈是确信无疑的。

sentences.english: In my younger days I read Voltaire's writings.
sentences.chinese: 我年轻的时候读过伏尔泰的着作。

definition: Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
Baruch or Benedict Spinoza (1632-1677), rationalist philosopher
Francis Bacon (1561-1626), English Renaissance philosopher and early scientist
pinyin: Fu2 lan2 xi1 si1 · Pei2 gen1

definition: Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky (1821-1881), great Russian novelist, author of Crime and Punishment 罪與罰|罪与罚[Zui4 yu3 Fa2]
pinyin: Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1

definition: René Descartes (1596-1650), French philosopher and author of Discours de la méthode 方法論|方法论
